2019-05-26T15:23:55Z: And here's the full report! Thanks for joining us this afternoon, it's been a blast. Au revoir, and see you for the Canadian Grand Prix in a couple of weeks' time. (Oh, and the Indy 500 is on in a couple of hours if you've not got your racing fill just yet...) Monaco Grand Prix: Hamilton escapes contact with Verstappen to winLewis Hamilton survived late contact with Max Verstappen to win Formula 1's Monaco Grand Prix, as an incident in the pitlane with Valtteri Bottas ultimately cost Verstappen second place
2019-05-26T15:14:01Z: Hamilton guns it down to the bottom of the podium and soaks everyone in sight. I think that was Nico Rosberg he chased after there...that sounds familiar, no?
2019-05-26T15:11:32Z: The British and German national anthems ring out over Monaco in deference to Hamilton's victory, performed by a live band. You have to wonder how many anthems they've learned in preparation...
2019-05-26T15:09:23Z: Lovely to see the Niki tribute hats on the podium. Well played.
2019-05-26T15:07:58Z: Ricciardo must have been absolutely flying at the end of that, as Grosjean has been demoted to P10. First points for Renault since China.
2019-05-26T15:01:18Z: Hamilton's celebrations are muted, and after that race, is it any surprise? He lifts aloft his Lauda tribute helmet in triumph.
2019-05-26T15:00:35Z: Just look at Hamilton's tyres. Wowzers.
2019-05-26T14:59:47Z: Gasly gets the fastest lap point, while Sainz, Kvyat, Albon, Grosjean and Ricciardo complete the top 10.
2019-05-26T14:56:39Z: Hamilton wins the Monaco Grand Prix, Verstappen crosses the line second but he'll fall to fourth behind Vettel and Bottas with his penalty.
2019-05-26T14:56:10Z: Verstappen is just too far back as they come out of the tunnel, it's going to be Hamilton's race and Verstappen won't even be on the podium.
2019-05-26T14:55:45Z: One lap to go sorry, even more of a last chance situation for Verstappen!
2019-05-26T14:55:18Z: Two laps to go, and Verstappen is back within 0.7s of Hamilton. Time for one more go...?
2019-05-26T14:54:50Z: That was a huge lunge from Verstappen towards the chicane, ending in a touch of right front to left rear. Hamilton just skipped over the chicane and continued unscathed.
2019-05-26T14:53:59Z: Verstappen keeps going too, but he's now 1.4s behind Hamilton with two and a half laps to go.
2019-05-26T14:53:31Z: Verstappen takes a lunge, they make slight contact! Hamilton holds on in the lead.
2019-05-26T14:51:33Z: That's a five-second time penalty for Grosjean. It's not going to have too much effect, but does end any chances of rising higher than ninth.
2019-05-26T14:51:10Z: Verstappen gets a big twitch out of Mirabeau, but gathers it all up quickly enough that he has a half-look at the chicane.
2019-05-26T14:49:40Z: Grosjean appears to have crossed the pit exit line post-stop. With his 16s gap to Ricciardo behind, it shouldn't be too much cause for concern, but it might be a penalty nonetheless...
2019-05-26T14:49:20Z: Another fastest lap for Gasly, he must be pretty certain of that point now with a 1m14.279s.
2019-05-26T14:47:49Z: Verstappen knows that even if he does passes Hamilton, he needs to do it with enough time to then pull a five-second gap. And there aren't many laps left in which to do that...
2019-05-26T14:47:21Z: Verstappen loses a bit of ground as he carries too much speed and has to cut over the run-off at the Swimming Pool.
2019-05-26T14:45:59Z: Just 2.7s cover the top four with nine laps left.
2019-05-26T14:45:31Z: Hamilton is properly clinging to the inside through the hairpins as Verstappen tries harder and harder.
2019-05-26T14:44:42Z: Russell's doing a fab job in the Williams, currently sitting in P15. Both Alfa Romeos are behind - the Swiss outfit is having a dismal weekend.
2019-05-26T14:43:43Z: All Verstappen can do at the moment is edge to Hamilton's outside going down to Loews and try to bother him. Everywhere else, the Mercedes is just far ahead enough.
2019-05-26T14:41:35Z: Gasly now takes fastest lap away from Bottas with a 1m14.567s - three seconds quicker than the leaders.
2019-05-26T14:40:17Z: Battle for the final point: Ricciardo's 22s behind Grosjean, and has Norris about 2s behind him. I think we drastically overplayed that, as Norris's softs begin to tire...
2019-05-26T14:40:11Z: That Bottas lap is two seconds faster than Hamilton is doing in the lead at the moment.
2019-05-26T14:39:55Z: Ah, Bottas's slow lap was to give him a bit of space to charge for fastest lap. Which he now pinches with a 1m15.163s.
2019-05-26T14:38:50Z: The official gap between Hamilton and Verstappen remains around half a second. Verstappen is right with the Mercedes into Loews every time and half looking to the outside just to unsettle the leader.
2019-05-26T14:37:41Z: A slow lap from Bottas, he's now 7s off the lead.
2019-05-26T14:37:30Z: I think we can put the hopes of rain on ice for the time being, threatening spits and dribbles of precipitation have so far amounted to nothing. 'Twas a nice thought, but these remaining 15 laps look like they'll stay dry. Has anyone got a sprinkler to spare?
2019-05-26T14:37:24Z: Incidentally that Gasly stop... he's now 34s off the lead, but on new softs and the leaders are going slowly. A bit of a charge now, and could he be in range if Hamilton does pit again?
2019-05-26T14:36:44Z: A little bit of shuffling in the Mercedes garage, but not exactly a scramble to hold a pitstop for a fuming race leader. Yet...
2019-05-26T14:36:25Z: Gasly pits from fifth place - which won't cost him a position as he had plenty of time in hand to the rest behind. He's back out on softs.
2019-05-26T14:34:21Z: Hamilton is quicker off Portier and through the tunnel, which is preventing Verstappen thinking about getting a run towards the chicane.
2019-05-26T14:33:53Z: Verstappen is now very, very close to Hamilton down the hill towards the tunnel.
2019-05-26T14:32:19Z: Lead gaps lap 59: 1 Hamilton; 2 Verstappen +0.7s; 3 Vettel +2.0s; 4 Bottas +3.1s
2019-05-26T14:31:13Z: Verstappen is getting closer and closer again.
2019-05-26T14:29:42Z: Verstappen had a slow lap while discussing that issue, but he's quickly back on Hamilton's tail again.
2019-05-26T14:29:32Z: Perez gets out of the way of the leaders on the run up to Massanet, letting Hulkenberg close right up to his tail.
2019-05-26T14:28:08Z: Hulkenberg seems to have pitted, rather than get in the way of the leaders. Perez will be next to be lapped.
2019-05-26T14:26:29Z: Vettel and Bottas are staying infuriatingly close for Verstappen, though. Right now, his penalty would still drop him to fourth.
2019-05-26T14:26:05Z: Still plenty of traffic ahead for the two leaders, but still - no matter what he says about the state of his tyres on the radio - Hamilton's lap times are holding up.
2019-05-26T14:25:29Z: A hairy moment for Kvyat! Sainz was lapping Kubica ahead, leaving nowhere for the Toro Rosso driver to go other than the run-off at the chicane. Strong evasive action, that could've been very nasty...
2019-05-26T14:23:13Z: Replays are being shown to emphasise just how messy Hamilton's left front tyre looks now. He's got to get 25 more laps out of it. His pace is still in the 1m17s at present.
2019-05-26T14:21:43Z: Grosjean's in, making a set of softs last 51 whole laps. He'll pop out in ninth place.
2019-05-26T14:21:40Z: With the upper midfield pitstops having unfolded, Gasly is back to his habitual 'lonely the leaders' spot, which today is fifth place - 12s from Bottas.
2019-05-26T14:20:42Z: Our esteemed video editor and paddock spy Luke Hinsull reports that the jackets are on at the Rascasse. Nothing much to show for it at the moment, we could do with more than a drizzle...
2019-05-26T14:20:17Z: Lead gaps with 29 laps to go: 1 Hamilton; 2 Verstappen +0.8s; 3 Vettel +2.3s; 4 Bottas +4.2s
2019-05-26T14:19:29Z: Stroll seemed to be slowing after Tabac to let Bottas through, but the Mercedes still ending up following him through the Swimming Pool chicane as a slow pace. But he's rapidly catching back up, such is the slow pace in traffic ahead.
2019-05-26T14:18:45Z: Norris has pitted from tenth, lifting Ricciardo up a place.
2019-05-26T14:18:12Z: Penalty for Stroll for a corner-cut, stewards are being kept very busy today.
2019-05-26T14:17:46Z: Vettel gets past Stroll but Bottas gets caught up and loses 3s in a slightly messy bit of lappery confusion.
2019-05-26T14:17:19Z: Raikkonen pits, leaving Ricciardo to conduct the train. The front runners are about to climb on board...
2019-05-26T14:17:18Z: This train of seven cars is proving really hard for Hamilton to get through, he makes it down the inside of Stroll into the chicane after a few tense corners and Verstappen follows.
2019-05-26T14:16:54Z: Perez seems the quickest out of this bunch - but he just can't get the job done. He's all over Magnussen like a rash, while Ricciardo's throwing everything but the kitchen sink at Raikkonen.
2019-05-26T14:15:07Z: Raikkonen, Ricciardo, Magnussen, Perez and Hulkenberg are forming a colossal train - and Russell's closing in on it too.
2019-05-26T14:13:56Z: Vettel has got a little closer to Hamilton and Verstappen now, and shaken off Bottas. Hard to see Mercedes resuming its one-two habit from here at the moment.
2019-05-26T14:13:30Z: Verstappen still isn't letting Hamilton get away, the gap remains 0.6s and the Red Bull gets ever so close in the slow corners. They're approaching a big train of traffic now.
2019-05-26T14:13:08Z: Some spots of rain are now appearing on camera lens. That's still a long way from this actually being a wet track, though. There are 34 laps to go.
2019-05-26T14:12:55Z: Fastest lap for Albon, a 1m15.607s on fresh mediums.
2019-05-26T14:11:21Z: Grosjean's doing some stellar laps on softs, keeping the life in them and lapping in the 1m16s and 1m17s. If he keeps that up, he might give the Toro Rossos a few problems after his inevitable pitstop.
2019-05-26T14:09:03Z: Albon comes in, and pops out into that nice P9 gap. It's all 'bon' for Albon.
2019-05-26T14:08:41Z: Hamilton laps Kubica without drama, but Verstappen is quickly past the Williams too.
2019-05-26T14:08:20Z: Stroll strolls into the pits, and drops down to P18. He's also under investigation for leaving the track and gaining an advantage.
2019-05-26T14:07:54Z: A close-up look at the pitlane incident that's left Verstappen carrying a 5s penalty
2019-05-26T14:06:31Z: A bit of a skirmish between Stroll and Raikkonen at Loews - the Racing Point locks up and nudges Raikkonen's sidepod at the exit.
2019-05-26T14:04:11Z: Verstappen remains within 0.6s of Hamilton now. Both have bands of graining on their front tyres but continue to lap in competitive 1m17s. Vettel and Bottas are just over two seconds further back.
2019-05-26T14:03:03Z: If Grosjean was any closer to that barrier at the Swimming Pool, it'd have been game over. Fractions-of-an-inch perfect.
2019-05-26T14:01:41Z: Hamilton asks whether Mercedes would go to the hard tyre if it stopped again. He's reassured that things are actually looking fine on the tyre front at the moment.
2019-05-26T14:00:50Z: It'll be quite low-risk if Albon and Grosjean want to stop now - there's an 8s gap between Kvyat in ninth and Norris in 10th.
2019-05-26T13:59:38Z: Albon might be next to pit, but he's lapping nicely in the high 1m16s still - so there's life in those softs.
2019-05-26T13:58:26Z: Kvyat's now in, he's been on a quick couple of laps after being released by Sainz. So close, but Sainz JUST ABOUT holds the position. Good stuff.
2019-05-26T13:57:37Z: Verstappen remains right on Hamilton's tail, and is tending to get better runs out of Rascasse, but there just isn't a way to overtake at the moment.
2019-05-26T13:56:20Z: Sainz is into the pits, elevating Kvyat and Albon to fifth and sixth. He returns to the circuit just behind Gasly - slotting into ninth.
2019-05-26T13:52:08Z: Lead gaps lap 28: 1 Hamilton; 2 Verstappen +0.6s; 3 Vettel +2.0s; 4 Bottas +2.9s
2019-05-26T13:51:45Z: Hamilton has picked up his pace from 1m18s to 1m17s, as coats begin to go on in the grandstands.
2019-05-26T13:50:56Z: Gasly goes onto mediums and rejoins ninth.
2019-05-26T13:50:36Z: Speaking of that, Gasly makes his pitstop now.
2019-05-26T13:50:21Z: Right now, Verstappen's penalty would drop him from second to fifth, although fifth-placed Gasly still has to make a pitstop.
2019-05-26T13:49:39Z: Ten second time penalty for Giovinazzi for pitching Kubica into a spin at the Rascasse.
2019-05-26T13:49:28Z: Perhaps inspired by that 'overtake Hamilton and drive into the distance' suggestion, Verstappen is now right under Hamilton's rear wing and pushing hard.
2019-05-26T13:47:22Z: Bit more urgency about Verstappen now with that penalty applied. He's still just 0.7s behind Hamilton.
2019-05-26T13:45:46Z: Behind Norris in P10, it's all pretty close. Stroll's within a second of the McLaren driver, but with Raikkonen right on his tail. Ricciardo, Magnussen, Perez and Hulkenberg are all chasing too.
2019-05-26T13:44:21Z: Verstappen is given a 5s time penalty for that unsafe release - right now that would drop him to seventh, but you'd expect this train to stretch out.
2019-05-26T13:43:51Z: Kvyat, having come under fire from team-mate Albon just a couple of laps prior, is now closing in on ex-Toro Rosso stablemate Sainz. P6 up for grabs here.
2019-05-26T13:40:46Z: Lap 19, and we're down to nineteen runners. Leclerc calls it a day in the pits, while Kubica and Giovinazzi are now under investigation for that Rascasse fracas.
2019-05-26T13:40:40Z: Hamilton's pace at the moment is 2s down on what he did in the first stint. He's got 59 laps to go and must be dubious about being able to on medium tyres, so taking it easy and keeping the pack at a controlled pace isn't a bad idea.
2019-05-26T13:38:14Z: Verstappen isn't letting Hamilton get away, staying with a second of the race leading Mercedes.
2019-05-26T13:37:45Z: Net result: Russell's back past Kubica. Leclerc's back in for some soft tyres, but this looks like a completely lost cause.
2019-05-26T13:37:25Z: Having another look at the Bottas/Verstappen pitlane incident - there was properly firm contact between the two cars and the Mercedes brushed the pitwall too.
2019-05-26T13:36:53Z: That's a traffic jam at the Rascasse! Giovinazzi punts Kubica into a spin, and forces Leclerc and Russell to come to a stop. Drama. Everyone's (largely) unscathed and back on course.
2019-05-26T13:36:20Z: Bottas is hassling Vettel now - not quite in the way Leclerc has been hassling people today, but pretty aggressively by Monaco standards.
2019-05-26T13:35:47Z: That snap of oversteer Vettel had out of Casino was properly alarming, coming just as he went onto the famous massive bump on the run to Mirabeau.
2019-05-26T13:34:30Z: Vettel had a big wobble out of Casino Square, and that lets Bottas attack him down the hill and try a run out of the tunnel, but it doesn't come off.
2019-05-26T13:34:13Z: That's one tight midfield pack. If this remains accident-free, that'll be quite something.
2019-05-26T13:33:30Z: Back to green flag racing as they begin lap 15. Smooth restart for the leaders.
2019-05-26T13:32:44Z: The safety car will be in at the end of this lap.
2019-05-26T13:32:36Z: Order: 1 Hamilton; 2 Verstappen; 3 Vettel; 4 Bottas; 5 Gasly; 6 Sainz; 7 Kvyat; 8 Albon; 9 Grosjean; 10 Norris; 11 Stroll; 12 Raikkonen; 13 Ricciardo; 14 Magnussen; 15 Kubica; 16 Giovinazzi; 17 Perez; 18 Hulkenberg; 19 Russell; 20 Leclerc
2019-05-26T13:30:49Z: So the lead order now is 1 Hamilton; 2 Verstappen; 3 Vettel; 4 Bottas, with only Hamilton on mediums and the rest on hards.
2019-05-26T13:30:26Z: Seems Mercedes suspected Bottas picked up a puncture in that pitlane brush with Verstappen, hence the stop.
2019-05-26T13:30:01Z: Bottas is coming back into the pits and going from mediums to hards. With the field still forming up behind the safety car, he gets back out still as high as fourth behind Verstappen and Vettel.
2019-05-26T13:29:59Z: Ricciardo and Magnussen are in for new tyres, and they've slid down the order in response. We can confirm that this hasn't worked out for Hulkenberg thus far, he's down in 18th place.
2019-05-26T13:29:14Z: That's going to be borderline for an 'unsafe release' call with Verstappen and Red Bull. Bottas claims he was pushed into the wall as Mercedes asks him if he has damage.
2019-05-26T13:28:22Z: Hamilton and Bottas both took mediums at their stops, Verstappen and Vettel went for hards.
2019-05-26T13:28:03Z: Hulkenberg pitted for hards moments before the safety car, has he timed that well?
2019-05-26T13:27:53Z: Verstappen and Vettel pit too, and Red Bull gets Verstappen out just (and we mean JUST) ahead of Bottas for second!
2019-05-26T13:27:41Z: Leclerc's weekend has definitely not been flawless, but he's currently floorless - the tyre chopped it away.
2019-05-26T13:27:31Z: Hamilton pits, and Bottas is hanging back so Mercedes can pull off a double stack stop.
2019-05-26T13:26:25Z: And now there is a safety car!
2019-05-26T13:26:13Z: Red Bull sends its crew into the pitlane just in case the debris from Leclerc causes a safety car, but no sign of that yet.
2019-05-26T13:26:10Z: Leclerc needs to slow that down, the flailing rubber is shredding the back of his car. In he comes to pit.
2019-05-26T13:25:30Z: And that's a puncture for Leclerc, he's dropping even further down the order.
2019-05-26T13:25:08Z: Contact! Leclerc attempts to double up at the Rascasse and tries to get P11 from Hulkenberg, but makes contact, spins and has it all to do again! Seems he just clipped the barrier and he's got a swapper on.
2019-05-26T13:24:45Z: Bottas takes fastest lap back, a 1m16.146s now.
2019-05-26T13:23:34Z: Great move by Leclerc! We said he couldn't pass at the Rascasse, but he's steamed past at a vast rate of knots, sweeps to the inside and clinches P12. Lovely.
2019-05-26T13:22:54Z: Lead gaps after lap seven: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +1.3s; 3 Verstappen +2.9s; 4 Vettel +4.8s
2019-05-26T13:22:26Z: This is where the race is - Leclerc attempts a stab past Grosjean into the Rascasse, but he can't pass at the 'casse. Sorry.
2019-05-26T13:22:17Z: Vettel gets fastest lap now, a 1m16.278s.
2019-05-26T13:21:27Z: The race control screen is now suggesting there's rain. Haven't yet seen any evidence of it in the sky or on the track.
2019-05-26T13:20:35Z: Leclerc has a look at Grosjean into the Nouvelle Chicane, but he's just not able to get the job done - Grosjean holds off the rapidly chasing Ferrari driver.
2019-05-26T13:18:42Z: Bottas pinches fastest lap from Hamilton with a 1m16.339s, 0.016s quicker than his team-mate that time around. They're 1.3s apart and yeah we're not above narrating a battle for a fastest lap bonus point if nothing else is going on.
2019-05-26T13:18:08Z: No further investigation at the start - good news for Leclerc, who's now right on the gearbox of Grosjean.
2019-05-26T13:17:19Z: Fastest lap down to 1m16.720s for Hamilton, who now leads by 1.3s after three laps. He's out of DRS range, which obviously doesn't make an enormous difference here. Or any.
2019-05-26T13:17:06Z: Turn 1 incident noted, so those who cut the corner are being looked at.
2019-05-26T13:16:22Z: Hamilton holds an early fastest lap of 1m17.129s, as you'd expect.
2019-05-26T13:16:09Z: Lead gaps after lap two: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +1.130s; 3 Verstappen +2.668s; 4 Vettel +4.227s
2019-05-26T13:15:57Z: Leclerc's cleared Norris now, he's up to 13th and will now go after Grosjean.
2019-05-26T13:14:59Z: Hamilton completes lap one with a 1.060s lead over Bottas, with Verstappen a further second back and then Sebastian Vettel already 3.8s from the front.
2019-05-26T13:14:50Z: Leclerc took to the escape road, but he's resumed his position - trying to pass Norris around the outside at Loews. Doesn't quite pull it off, unfortunately.
2019-05-26T13:14:29Z: Verstappen was clearly edging ahead of Bottas for second as they went into the first corner, but Bottas managed to keep momentum around the outside and hold the place.
2019-05-26T13:14:09Z: Magnussen drops to sixth, falling behind Ricciardo off the line.
2019-05-26T13:13:18Z: Max Verstappen is straight up the inside of Valtteri Bottas off the line but can't get second into Ste Devote. Lewis Hamilton still leads a Mercedes one-two up the hill.
2019-05-26T13:12:48Z: The cars wind around the final corners, preparing for the start of the 77th Monaco Grand Prix.
2019-05-26T13:12:46Z: The two Mercedes form up on the front of the grid.
2019-05-26T13:12:07Z: Otherwise, a one-stop is expected. Leclerc's on mediums, hoping to go longer and pick up some track position as the soft-starters pit sooner.
2019-05-26T13:11:12Z: It's the formation lap! Risk of rain apparently sits at 90%...oooooh.
2019-05-26T13:10:35Z: Lewis Hamilton's race engineer hints at rain, and the default will be to switch to intermediate tyres if the clouds break. Nothing high-intensity, but let's see what happens...
2019-05-26T13:05:46Z: Five minutes until lights out, and then the race in Monte Carlo will be Mona-GO.
2019-05-26T13:04:34Z: The weather, so far, is dry. But there's murmurings of rain - and that can always spice things up here. Let's not hold our collective breaths, but there's a chance!
2019-05-26T13:03:22Z: It's an all-Mercedes front row, with Verstappen and Vettel behind. Then, in fifth, it's Kevin Magnussen - who could be something of a wildcard here if he gets a good start.
2019-05-26T13:02:35Z: A sea of red caps were out on the grid previously, a lovely tribute to Niki Lauda amid the one-minute silence.
2019-05-26T13:00:41Z: Good afternoon everyone, and welcome to the Autosport Live commentary for the Monaco Grand Prix. As ever, the grid is packed to the rafters with celebrities and stars from all walks of life, but it's not about them - it's about the 20 drivers on the grid. So, what's going to happen today?
